results.title: Working
results.creator_credit: Alasdair Clayre, Nigel Houghton, Patrick Lui and Peter Montagnon
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Heart of the Dragon”.
This program is Part Six of a twelve episode documentary, The Heart of the Dragon. The documentary records what is actually happening in China today and it captures on film the lives of peasants, factory workers, Party officials, artists, scientists, and even millionaires.

results.title: Caring
results.creator_credit: Alasdair Clayre, Nigel Houghton, Patrick Lui and Peter Montagnon
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Heart of the Dragon”.
This program visits Minus Eighteen Street in northern Harbin (Ha-erh-pin) to examine urban life in China, using the family of a railway policeman as an example. Also looks at institutions for those with whom the community cannot cope. Highlights how life is governed by concepts of honour, moral conduct, courtesy and respectful behaviour which are deep rooted in Chinese society.

results.title: Mediating
results.creator_credit: Alasdair Clayre, Nigel Houghton, Patrick Lui and Peter Montagnon
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “Heart of the Dragon”.
This program is about the breakdown of a marriage and the pressures that are brought on the couple to reconcile their differences. Highlights that, in China, society comes before the individual and the family must be maintained, whatever the cost.

results.title: Eating
results.creator_credit: Alasdair Clayre, Nigel Houghton, Patrick Lui and Peter Montagnon
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Heart of the Dragon”.
This program contrasts food habits and agricultural conditions in China and considers how long China can continue to support a population which, despite birth control, continues to grow at an alarming rate.

results.title: Creating
results.creator_credit: Alasdair Clayre, Nigel Houghton, Patrick Lui and Peter Montagnon
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “Heart of the Dragon”.
This program looks at the world of contemporary Chinese art, exploring the philosophic and historic influences that shape it. The way that Chinese artists pursue the essence of “reality” is examined as are the techniques which combine traditional values with unconventional materials to produce works that are resplendently Chinese.

results.title: Render: spanning time with Ani DiFranco
results.creator_credit: Ani DiFranco, Hilary Goldberg, Commi Fag and Righteous Babe
results.brief_description: All decent people, male and female, are feminists. The only people who are not feminists are those who believe that women are inherently inferior or undeserving of the respect and opportunity afforded men. Either you are a feminist or you are a sexist/misogynist. There is no box marked other”.”….Ani DiFranco. Political, passionate and dedicated feminist, folksinger (with a raw edge) Ani DiFranco, along with her band Righteous Babe, provides an insight into her music and her mind through this independently made documentary film. Spanning back from 1997 through to 2001 the film follows Ani and her entourage as they criss-cross the US performing live concerts to a devoted following every where they go. Includes on-stage footage from New Orleans, Buffalo NY, Austin, Knoxville, Atlanta, Memphis, Nashville, New Haven, Columbia interspersed with frank and upfront interviews with Ani and an inside look at how the band operates during these performances. Two of Ani’s passions are also explored here - feminism and her fight against the death penalty - and includes guest appearances by Utah Phillips, Hamell on Trial, Palmer Singleton (Defense Attorney, Southern Center for Human Rights), Sekou Sundiata, Bitch and Animal, Erin McKeown. Ani is magnetic. Her voice, energy and commitment to her art form uncompromising - 12 studio albums, including two collaborations with Utah Phillips have been released since the beginning of Righteous Babe Records in the early 90s. A great documentary for those into independent music. NOTE: Contains low level coarse language.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ani DiFranco, Hilary Goldberg, Commi Fag and Righteous Babe

results.title: Remembering
results.creator_credit: Alasdair Clayre, Nigel Houghton, Patrick Lui and Mischa Scorer
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Heart of the Dragon”.
This series documents the historical and cultural traditions of China, showing how attitudes in China today are shaped not only by the doctrines of Marx and Mao but also by ancient beliefs and traditions and by the living memories of recent cataclysmic events. This program seeks to identify what it is that unifies a quarter of the world’s population. Uses both original footage and archive material to give a broad overview of historic and modern China.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alasdair Clayre, Nigel Houghton, Patrick Lui and Mischa Scorer

results.title: Correcting
results.creator_credit: Alasdair Clayre, Nigel Houghton, Patrick Lui and Peter Montagnon
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Heart of the Dragon”.
This program follows the trial of Nie Chengying, accused of stealing from her neighbour, to show the legal system at work in China. The legal system not only aims to punish and protect society, but also seeks to restore the social harmony which has been disturbed by the crime. Also explores the social pressures at work in the new consumer society which may cause a person to commit a crime.
